p: Some flavonoids have been characterized as HIV-1-RT inhibitors. Furthermore, previous reports showed that these compounds, particularly myricetin and myricetin 3-rhamnoside, could occupy the NNRTI pocket (Li et al., 2011[ 22]; Ortega et al., 2017[ 34]). Thus, molecular docking study of glycosylated flavonoids (MyrG and MyrGG) and methoxyflavones (PMF and PMF-OH) into the NNRTI pocket on the HBV-RT model were carried out. Figure 5 (Fig. 5) shows the docking representation of the MyrG (A) and PMF (B) on the HBV-RT model, and Table 3 (Tab. 3) summarizes the docking scores for the ligands evaluated in this study. The compounds that best interact with the NNRTI pocket were the methoxyflavones. However, the best-docked compound was PMF-OH, with a binding energy of -5.59 kcal/mol. The compound PMF shows binding energy of -5.33 kcal/mol. However, the glycosylated flavonoids showed lower binding energy than methoxyflavones. The best ranked binding energy was for MyrG with a binding energy of -4.61 Kcal/mol. All these results are summarized in Table 3 (Tab. 3).
